news_articles: An Ethiopian airstrike reportedly hit Mekelle, the capital of the northern region of Tigray on Thursday. Tigrayan forces said three civilians were killed in their homes by the airstrike, which reportedly hit Mekelle's residential Kebele 5 area. Meanwhile, Ethiopia's government said the airstrike hit a factory complex, which Tigray People's Liberation Front was using to maintain military equipment.
title: Airstrike hits capital of Ethiopia's Tigray; 3 killed: Report | World News | Inshorts
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

news_articles: NCB officer Sameer Wankhede's wife and actress Kranti Redkar has written a letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray over "attack on her family and her personal life". She wrote, "We're being insulted before people every day. A woman's dignity is being toyed with in Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's state." She added, "Had Balasaheb been here today, he wouldn't have liked it."Ex-tennis player Leander Paes today joined TMC in Goa in presence of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. Earlier today, actress Nafisa Ali and Mrinalini Deshprabhu joined the party. This comes ahead of the 2022 Assembly elections in Goa. "Together, we shall ensure every single person in India sees Dawn of Democracy that we've been waiting for since 2014!" TMC tweeted.Bypolls to three Parliamentary constituencies of UT of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Madhya Pradesh and Himachal Pradesh will be held tomorrow, October 30. The bypolls to 30 Assembly seats spread across 14 states will also be held tomorrow. Voting will start from 7 am, while the counting of votes will take place on November 2.The Department of Expenditure, which comes under the Finance Ministry, on Wednesday asked all ministries and departments to clear dues of Air India and purchase tickets by making cash payments. Since the disinvestment process of Air India has started, the airline has stopped extending credit limit, it said. Earlier, the government sold Air India to Tata Sons for ₹18,000 crore. Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said BJP is going to be the centre of Indian polity and it's not going anywhere for many decades. He said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi doesn't realise this. "That's where the problem lies with Rahul probably. He thinks it's just a matter of time that people will throw [PM Modi] away. That's not happening," Kishor added.During a Congress meeting, Rahul Gandhi questioned how relevant are the party's rules like wearing khadi and not consuming alcohol to become a member of Congress. "How many of these rules are followed today? How many people in this room drink alcohol," Rahul asked. Two general secretaries admitted that they drink alcohol, according to reports.Actress Kamya Panjabi, who joined the Congress party in the presence of Mumbai Congress President Bhai Jagtap, took to Instagram to share the news. Sharing a post, she wrote, "Beautiful start to my new beginning! Thank you...@bhaijagtapofficial bhai @tehseenpoonawala @incmumbai for such a warm welcome...looking forward to start working under the leadership of @rahulgandhi @priyankagandhivadra."West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee during her address in Goa's Panaji on Friday ahead of state Assembly elections said that she "wasn't there to capture power". "It touches my heart if we...help people when they face trouble," she added. "Bengal is a very strong state. We want to see that Goa is a strong state for future," she further said.Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to order an independent probe into the Pegasus issue and claimed that only the PM or Home Minister can give approval for it. "Even if this data was on PM's desk, then that too is totally criminal," he further said, adding "The Prime Minister is not above the nation".Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said the three agricultural laws will also be revoked just like the barricades were removed from farmers' protest site. "Hail Annadata Satyagraha," he tweeted in Hindi. Earlier, Delhi Police began removing the barricades and concertina wires installed in Ghazipur. "The temporary barricading is being removed to ease out vehicular movement," an officer said.Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Wednesday alleged that BJP is distributing money in the Sindgi and the Hangal constituencies in Karnataka. "Ten to 12 ministers in each constituency are holding a bag of money to distribute it to people to purchase votes. This doesn't work," he stated. Siddaramaiah added that Congress will file a complaint with the election commission officials.Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to form a three-member panel of cyber experts to probe the alleged use of Pegasus for surveillance. He said snooping using Pegasus is an attempt to crush Indian democracy. "I am confident that we will get the truth out of this," Rahul added.Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Friday met the families of four farmers, who allegedly fell ill and died while waiting in queue to purchase fertiliser in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur. Priyanka also criticised the government over the shortage of fertilisers, alleging that it has "failed and completely ignored farmers". "Lesser quantity of fertiliser is now being given in sacks," she claimed.Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday addressed the launch event of ''Mera Parivaar-BJP Parivaar'' membership drive in Uttar Pradesh. During the event, Shah said, "If you want to make [Narendra Modi] PM again in 2024, make [Yogi Adityanath] the [CM of Uttar Pradesh] again in 2022." "Without Uttar Pradesh, there cannot be a government at the Centre," he added.Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh's meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah on the ongoing farmers' protest over the Centre's new farm laws on Thursday was postponed. As per reports, Shah was to leave for Gujarat. On Wednesday, Amarinder had said that he was going to meet Shah in Delhi with a delegation of 25-30 people.The BJP has decided to stage a demonstration in support of NCB's Sameer Wankhede in Mumbai on Friday. Notably, five cases have been filed against Wankhede. The NCB officer had earlier approached Bombay HC over the inquiry initiated against him by the Maharashtra government. Wankhede said the extortion charges must be probed by a central agency. BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav alleged the party's MP Varun Gandhi has been speaking against BJP's policies, adding, "it's not appropriate for him to do". Yadav said, "It looks like...[he's] feeling uncomfortable with BJP." This comes after Gandhi on Friday said the farmers would continue to be exploited in mandis till there is no legal guarantee for MSPs of crops.Addressing TMC workers in Goa on Friday, West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said BJP calls her "anti-Hindu, but they're no one to give her character certificate". Banerjee said TMC doesn't divide people on the basis of religion, adding, "We unite people". She added the three letters in her party name, TMC, stand for temple, mosque and church.The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed an interim chargesheet against four accused in the murder case of former Andhra Pradesh MP YS Vivekananda Reddy. He was found brutally murdered at his residence in Pulivendula in March 2019 ahead of the general elections. The case was probed by the Andhra Pradesh Police and other agencies for around 18 months.Former J&K CM and NC leader Omar Abdullah on Friday criticised behaviour of lawyers in Agra towards three Kashmiri students who were arrested for allegedly celebrating Pakistan's win over India in the T20 World Cup. He was referring to reports that Kashmiri students were heckled while coming out of court. "The role of the police is deeply (suspected)," he tweeted.Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal will be on a two-day visit to poll-bound Punjab from Thursday. Kejriwal, the Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor, will meet farmers in the Mansa area of the state on the first day of his visit. On Friday, he will go to Bathinda and meet businessmen there.Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Thursday alleged that the Congress has taken no initiative to build an opposition alliance and it is limited to Twitter space. In an editorial in its mouthpiece 'Jago Bangla', TMC said, "We want an alliance to be formed against BJP. We have said this to Congress too. But it's least bothered and shows a lackadaisical approach."RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday alleged that the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government is distributing liquor and giving saree to women in the name of Chhath Puja. It is also distributing money to people, he added. "If the government would have done some development work then this situation of distributing these things wouldn't have arisen," Tejashwi further said.Aam Aadmi Party Councillor Sahista joined the Congress in the presence of Delhi Congress chief Anil Kumar on Wednesday. She said AAP workers and elected leaders feel suffocated with the "one-man show" in the party. Sahista, who represents the Sri Ram Colony ward in North East Delhi, joined the Congress along with her supporters.
title: Political News: Government Politics News in English with Inshorts

news_articles: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted "Wild $T1mes" after his electric carmaking company hit $1 trillion in market capitalisation for the first time. On Monday, Tesla shares surged 14.9% to $1,045.02 after American car rental company Hertz ordered 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Musk got $36 billion richer in a day and his wealth surged to $289 billion.The news of American car rental company Hertz placing an order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars generated $119 billion jump in market value for the buyer and seller combined. Tesla added $118 billion, taking its total market value to over $1 trillion, while Hertz gained $1.17 billion in market value. Hertz will spend $4.2 billion on the cars, Bloomberg reported.Chinese electric vehicle maker XPeng presented plans for a flying car that can also be driven on the road. The car, that XPeng aims to price lower than RMB 1 million (₹1.17 crore), converts to a flying car through a foldable rotor mechanism. It will have a steering wheel for road operations and a single lever for flight modes.Japanese startup A.L.I. Technologies on Tuesday began selling its 'XTurismo Limited Edition' hoverbike for 77.7 million yen (₹5.09 crore). The hoverbike is equipped with a conventional engine and four battery-powered motors and promises to fly for 40 minutes at up to 100 kmph. The startup is backed by Mitsubishi Electric, soccer player Keisuke Honda and others.World's richest person Elon Musk's net worth crossed $250 billion as shares of Tesla hit fresh all-time highs on Friday. The electric car maker's stock closed at around $910 per share, taking its market value to more than $900 billion for the first time ever. Musk reportedly has a stake of more than 20% in Tesla.Niti Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar urged Elon Musk-led Tesla to "come and manufacture" in India. "You (Tesla) will get all the tax benefits you want. The argument that we'll create a market by exporting into India finished products...is an old argument," he added. Earlier, reports said Tesla urged PM Narendra Modi's office to slash import taxes on electric vehicles.Ola on Thursday announced its plans to hire 10,000 new people across its sales and service centres. Ola is eyeing a $2 billion Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) for its vehicle commerce platform Ola Cars over the next 12 months. Ola's newly-formed Ola Cars vertical allows consumers to purchase new as well as pre-owned vehicles through the Ola app.The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways unveiled draft rules for the safety of children below four years carried on a motorcycle. The rules include attaching the child to the driver with a safety harness and usage of a crash helmet by kids aged between nine months and four years. They also recommend limiting the vehicle's speed to 40 kmph.Uber has partnered with Hertz to offer 50,000 Tesla vehicles as a rental option to its drivers by 2023. Drivers will be able to rent a Tesla starting on November 1 in Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego and Washington DC, with the programme expanding nationwide later. The programme could expand to 1.5 lakh Teslas during the next three years.Bajaj Auto's MD Rajiv Bajaj on Thursday took a jibe at startups that have entered the electric scooter segment and said that legacy companies like theirs eat OATS (Ola, Ather, Tork Motors and SmartE) for breakfast. "I'm going to bet on BET — Bajaj, (Royal) Enfield and TVS," he said. "They have a proven track record," he added. Japanese startup A.L.I. Technologies, which began selling its 'XTurismo Limited Edition' hoverbike for 77.7 million yen (over ₹5 crore), organised a demo to show its hoverbike floating in the air. The hoverbike promises to fly for 40 minutes at speeds of up to 100 kmph. It'll soon get a fully-electric version and only 200 units will be made for now.Tesla's Model 3 has become the first electric car to top monthly sales of new cars in Europe, outselling rival models with gasoline engines. World's richest person Elon Musk-led electric carmaker sold 24,600 Tesla Model 3 cars in September, recording year-on-year growth of 58%, research group JATO Dynamics said. Renault's Clio ranked second with 18,264 units, followed by Dacia's Sandero.The government is planning to pitch to companies such as Tesla, Samsung and LG Energy to encourage them to invest in manufacturing batteries locally, Reuters reported quoting government sources. India will reportedly host five roadshows starting next month in several countries to convince battery makers to set up local production. It includes countries like US, Germany, France, South Korea, Japan.Electric car startup Lucid Group's CEO Peter Rawlinson said that it will likely take a decade before self-driving taxis or robotaxis are deployed on roads. "I think we're 10 years out before we see fleets of robotaxis...There is a mountain to climb - an intellectual mountain to climb in terms of software," Rawlinson, a former chief engineer at Tesla, added.Tesla has increased the price of its Model X Long Range and Model S Long Range variants by $5,000 in US. The Model X Long Range and Model S Long Range now sell for $104,990 and $94,990 respectively. The electric car maker also increased the price of its Model Y Long Range and Model 3 Standard Range Plus by $2,000.Tesla has rolled out Full Self-Driving Beta version 10.3.1 following a brief roll back after bugs were found in the initial rollout of software Version 10.3. Users' posts claimed Teslas with the latest 10.3 software repeatedly provided Forward Collision Warnings when there was no immediate danger. "Issue turned out to be power saving mode interacting with FSD," Elon Musk said.Apple's talks with China's CATL and BYD over battery supplies for its planned electric vehicle have been mostly stalled, Reuters reported. The companies have reportedly refused to set up teams and build US plants that will solely cater to Apple. The iPhone maker is now said to be considering Japanese battery makers, including Panasonic.Tesla has said it will use cheaper lithium-iron-phosphate batteries in its standard-range vehicles across global markets. The firm has been using LFP batteries in China supplied by Contemporary Amperex Technology. Tesla CFO Zach Kirkhorn confirmed during an investor call on Wednesday that the company has seen pricing impacts to nickel and aluminium.US government agency NTSB has written to Tesla CEO Elon Musk asking to change the design of Tesla's advanced driver assistance system to ensure safety and stop misuse by drivers. The agency also expressed concern that Tesla is yet to implement its safety recommendations issued over four years ago. The NTSB can make recommendations but has no enforcement authority.Tata Motors DVR's shares rose 10% to close at ₹255.85 on the BSE. This comes after the company's latest shareholding pattern showed that billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala raised his stake in the firm to 3.93% in the September quarter from 1.97% in the June quarter. Meanwhile, he held a 1.11% stake in Tata Motors at the end of September quarter.After US car rental company Hertz's order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars led to a surge in Tesla's stock price, CEO Elon Musk said, "To be clear, cars sold to Hertz have no discount. Same price as to consumers." Tesla's market capitalisation also surpassed $1 trillion. "Strange that moved valuation, as Tesla is very much a production ramp problem," Musk noted.Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover has decided to extend production cuts in the current quarter amid the global semiconductor chip shortage, The Economic Times reported. It has scheduled production shutdown at its Nitra and Solihull plants, while the plant in Graz will also witness no-production days, it added. This may result in an incremental revenue loss of about ₹3,100-3,350 crore.Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean subsidiary SsangYong Motor Company has reportedly named a consortium led by South Korean electric vehicle startup Edison Motors as its preferred bidder. The deal is estimated to be worth about $260 million, Nikkei reported. SsangYong, which was put under court receivership earlier this year, was acquired by Mahindra & Mahindra for $463 million in 2011.Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava said the company will launch electric vehicles (EVs) in the country only after 2025 as demand for such vehicles is less at the moment. Maruti would like to sell around 10,000 units a month whenever it enters the electric mobility space, he added. Bhargava said it's difficult to predict pricing of EVs at present.
title: Automobile News: Latest Car and Bike News Updates in English with Inshorts

news_articles: ऑस्ट्रेलियाई ओलंपियन ऐलेक्स पुलिन के निधन के 15-महीने बाद उनकी गर्लफ्रेंड एलिडी पुलिन ने उनकी बेटी को जन्म दिया है। एलिडी ने तस्वीर शेयर कर लिखा, "मिन्नी ऐलेक्स पुलिन...का जन्म 25 अक्टूबर 2021 को हुआ।" इससे पहले उन्होंने बताया था कि पुलिन के निधन के बाद उनके शरीर से लिए गए स्पर्म से आईवीएफ के ज़रिए वह गर्भवती हुई थीं।दिल्ली आपदा प्रबंधन प्राधिकरण (डीडीएमए) ने शुक्रवार को कोविड-19 प्रतिबंधों में ढील देते हुए सोमवार (1 नवंबर) से सिनेमाहॉल, थिएटर और मल्टीप्लेक्स 100% क्षमता के साथ खोलने की अनुमति दे दी। इसके अलावा शादी व अंतिम संस्कार में शामिल होने वालों की संख्या 100 से बढ़ाकर 200 कर दी गई है। वहीं, शहर के अधिकृत साप्ताहिक बाज़ार सोमवार से खुलेंगे।चंडीगढ़ के उपभोक्ता विवाद निवारण आयोग ने एक ट्रैवल फर्म और मनाली स्थित होटल को बुकिंग के समय बालकनी व्यू की फेक फोटो शेयर कर हनीमून बर्बाद करने के लिए एक कपल को ₹27,302 देने का आदेश दिया है। इसमें ₹10,302 रिफंड, ₹10,000 हर्जाना और ₹7,000 कानूनी खर्च शामिल है। बकौल आयोग, "नवविवाहितों के लिए हनीमून काफी अहम होता है।"इलाहाबाद हाईकोर्ट ने दो लिव-इन कपल्स की याचिकाओं पर सुनवाई के दौरान कहा है कि लिव-इन रिलेशनशिप जीवन का अहम हिस्सा बन गए हैं। बकौल कोर्ट, "लिव-इन रिलेशनशिप को सामाजिक नैतिकता के पैमाने पर नहीं बल्कि व्यक्तिगत स्वायत्तता के नज़रिए से देखने की ज़रूरत है।" कपल्स ने लड़कियों के परिजनों पर उनके जीवन में दखल देने का आरोप लगाया है।संघ लोक सेवा आयोग (यूपीएससी) ने 10 अक्टूबर को हुई सिविल सेवा प्रारंभिक परीक्षा 2021 के परिणाम शुक्रवार को घोषित कर दिए। परीक्षा में भाग लेने वाले अभ्यर्थी यूपीएससी की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट upsc.gov.in पर अपना रिज़ल्ट देख सकते हैं। परीक्षा पहले 27 जून को होने वाली थी लेकिन कोविड-19 मामलों में वृद्धि के कारण स्थगित कर दी गई थी।आर्यन खान की जेल से रिहाई से पहले शाहरुख खान के घर 'मन्नत' को लाइट्स से सजाया गया है जिसकी तस्वीर सामने आई है। बॉम्बे हाईकोर्ट ने क्रूज़ ड्रग्स मामले में गुरुवार को आर्यन को ज़मानत दे दी थी और शनिवार को उनके जेल से बाहर आने की संभावना है। शाहरुख के घर के बाहर कई फैन्स भी एकत्रित हुए।कन्नड़ ऐक्टर पुनीत राजकुमार के निधन के बाद बेंगलुरु पुलिस ने तत्काल प्रभाव से 31 अक्टूबर की मध्यरात्रि तक बेंगलुरु में शराब की बिक्री पर प्रतिबंध लगाने की घोषणा की है। उन्हें श्रद्धांजलि देने के लिए शहर में कई दुकानें, कार्यालय और पब बंद कर दिए गए। पुनीत का बेंगलुरु में शुक्रवार को हार्ट अटैक से निधन हो गया।मुंबई में आर्थर रोड जेल के बाहर शुक्रवार को भारी ट्रैफिक जाम देखा गया। इस जेल में बंद अभिनेता शाहरुख खान के बेटे आर्यन खान को शुक्रवार शाम को रिहा किए जाने की संभावना थी। इसे लेकर जेल के एक अधिकारी ने कहा, "भीड़ बढ़ने पर हमने स्थानीय पुलिस को सूचित किया जिसके बाद उन्होंने...अपने अधिकारियों को तैनात किया।"कन्नड़ ऐक्टर पुनीत राजकुमार का शुक्रवार को 46-वर्ष की उम्र में निधन के बाद उनकी आखें बेंगलुरु के नारायण नेत्रालय को दान की गई हैं। इससे पहले 2006 में पुनीत के दिवंगत पिता डॉक्टर राजकुमार की आंखें भी दान की गई थीं। 'पावर स्टार' कहे जाने वाले पुनीत को शुक्रवार सुबह जिम में कसरत करते समय हार्ट अटैक आया था।जी20 शिखर सम्मेलन में भाग लेने के लिए रोम (इटली) पहुंचे प्रधानमंत्री नरेंद्र मोदी का पियाज़ा गांधी में कई लोगों ने स्वागत किया है। इस दौरान एक महिला ने गुजराती में पीएम मोदी से पूछा, "नरेंद्र भाई केम छो? (आप कैसे हैं)?" जिस पर पीएम ने कहा, "मजा मा छो (मैं ठीक हूं)।" एएनआई ने इसका वीडियो शेयर किया है।वेस्टइंडीज़ ने शुक्रवार को बांग्लादेश को 3 रनों से हराकर टी20 विश्व कप 2021 में अपनी पहली जीत दर्ज की। इस विश्व कप में बांग्लादेश अब लगातार 3 मैच हार चुका है और सुपर 12 में ग्रुप 1 की अंकतालिका में अंतिम स्थान पर है। वहीं, वेस्टइंडीज़ 3 मैचों में 1 जीत के साथ अंकतालिका में पांचवें स्थान पर है।अफगानिस्तान के 23-वर्षीय लेग-स्पिनर राशिद खान टी20I क्रिकेट इतिहास में सबसे तेज़ 100 विकेट लेने वाले गेंदबाज़ बन गए हैं। राशिद ने शुक्रवार को अपने 53वें मैच में पाकिस्तान के मोहम्मद हफीज़ को आउट करने के बाद यह उपलब्धि हासिल की। उन्होंने श्रीलंकाई पूर्व पेसर लसिथ मलिंगा का रिकॉर्ड तोड़ा जिन्होंने अपने 76वें मैच में 100वां टी20I विकेट लिया था।पाकिस्तानी बल्लेबाज़ आसिफ अली द्वारा 19वें ओवर में लगाए गए 4 छक्कों की बदौलत पाकिस्तान ने शुक्रवार को टी20 विश्व कप 2021 में अफगानिस्तान को 5 विकेट से हरा दिया। आसिफ ने 7 गेंदों पर नाबाद 25 रन बनाए। पाकिस्तान 3 मैचों में 3 जीत के साथ सुपर 12 चरण के ग्रुप 2 की अंकतालिका में शीर्ष पर बरकरार है।पूर्व पाकिस्तानी पेसर शोएब अख्तर ने पीटीवी के उस बयान पर प्रतिक्रिया व्यक्त की है जिसमें कहा गया कि चैनल ने अख्तर और होस्ट नोमान नियाज़ को ऑफ-एयर कर दिया है। बकौल अख्तर, "अच्छा...यह मज़ेदार है...मैंने 22 करोड़ पाकिस्तानियों और दुनियाभर के अरबों लोगों के सामने इस्तीफा दिया। क्या पीटीवी पागल है? मुझे ऑफ-एयर करने वाले वे कौन होते हैं?"सुप्रीम कोर्ट ने शुक्रवार को कहा कि पटाखों पर पूरी तरह प्रतिबंध नहीं है और वही पटाखे प्रतिबंधित हैं जो स्वास्थ्य के लिए हानिकारक हैं। बेरियम से बने पटाखों के प्रतिबंधित होने की बात कहते हुए कोर्ट ने कहा, "दूसरों के...स्वास्थ्य की कीमत पर...त्योहार नहीं हो सकता।" कोर्ट ने हानिकारक पटाखों पर सख्ती से प्रतिबंध लागू करने का निर्देश दिया।महाराष्ट्र के मंत्री नवाब मलिक ने एनसीबी के अधिकारी समीर वानखेड़े को लेकर शुक्रवार को कहा, "आर्यन और अन्य को ज़मानत नहीं मिले...उसके लिए सब कुछ करने वाला शख्स....अब (अपने लिए) कोर्ट का दरवाज़ा खटखटा रहा।" बकौल मलिक, "एक महीने में स्थिति पूरी तरह बदल गई है।" वानखेड़े ने गुरुवार को बॉम्बे हाईकोर्ट से गिरफ्तारी से अंतरिम राहत मांगी थी।ऑस्ट्रेलिया में आकाशीय बिजली की चपेट में आने वाले 14-वर्षीय टैलिन रोज़ की मां को डॉक्टरों ने बताया कि वह इस घटना में बच गया क्योंकि उसके रबड़ के सोल वाले जूतों ने अधिकांश करंट अवशोषित कर लिया। टैलिन के स्कूल जाने के दौरान बिजली एक धातुई खंभे से टकराकर उसके शरीर से गुज़री जिससे वह ज़मीन पर गिर गया।अमेरिकी सॉफ्टवेयर कंपनी माइक्रोसॉफ्ट कॉर्प ने शुक्रवार को एप्पल इंक को पछाड़कर दुनिया की सबसे मूल्यवान पब्लिक कंपनी का तमगा हासिल कर लिया। शुक्रवार को माइक्रोसॉफ्ट का बाज़ार पूंजीकरण बढ़कर $2.46 लाख करोड़ हो गया जबकि एप्पल का पूंजीकरण घटकर $2.41 लाख करोड़ रहा। विश्लेषकों की उम्मीदों से कम कमाई होने के बाद एप्पल के शेयरों में गिरावट आई है।अभिनेता मनोज बाजपेयी ने एक इंटरव्यू में कहा कि उनकी पत्नी शबाना व बेटी एवा नायला ने उनका शो 'द फैमिली मैन' बहुत पसंद किया। बकौल मनोज, शबाना उनकी फिल्मों व परफॉर्मेंसेज़ की समीक्षा करते वक्त 'बहुत ईमानदारी' बरतती हैं। मनोज ने कहा, "अगर शबाना को कुछ पसंद नहीं आया...तो वह बहुत ईमानदारी से आलोचना करेंगी...लेकिन मुझे यह पसंद है।"अभिनेता पीयूष मिश्रा से जब आर्यन खान की ज़मानत पर प्रतिक्रिया मांगी गई तो उन्होंने कहा, "मेरा रिएक्शन क्या होगा?...किया उसने...उसको बेल मिल गई।" उन्होंने आगे कहा, "अब शाहरुख खान, उनका बेटा जाने या समीर वानखेड़े जाने...मुझे उससे क्या मतलब?" फिल्म 'दिल से' में शाहरुख के को-स्टार रहे पीयूष ने कहा, "जो किया है वह भुगतेंगे आप...अपने-अपने बच्चों को संभालें।"तृणमूल कांग्रेस (टीएमसी) अध्यक्ष ममता बनर्जी ने शुक्रवार को गोवा में पार्टी के कार्यकर्ताओं से कहा कि बीजेपी उन्हें 'हिंदू विरोधी' कहती है लेकिन उसे उन्हें 'चरित्र प्रमाण पत्र' देने का कोई अधिकार नहीं है। बनर्जी ने कहा कि उनकी पार्टी के नाम ‘टीएमसी’ में 'टी' का अर्थ टेंपल (मंदिर), 'एम' का मॉस्क (मस्जिद) और 'सी' का चर्च (गिरजाघर) है।केंद्रीय मंत्री रामदास अठावले ने आरोप लगाया है कि महाराष्ट्र के मंत्री नवाब मलिक फिल्म इंडस्ट्री को बदनाम कर रहे हैं। उन्होंने कहा, "मलिक को इस तरह से आरोप नहीं लगाने चाहिए...एनसीबी अधिकारी समीर वानखेड़े के बाद अब वह मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ पर आरोप लगा रहे हैं।" बकौल अठावले, "वानखेड़े और...हम लोग इंडस्ट्री को सुधारने की कोशिश कर रहे हैं।"विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठन (डब्ल्यूएचओ) ने शुक्रवार को बताया कि टेड्रोस एधेनॉम गेब्रियेसस को संगठन के प्रमुख पद के लिए निर्विरोध दोबारा चुना गया है उनका दूसरा कार्यकाल 5 साल का होगा। हालांकि, औपचारिक घोषणा मई में होने वाली संगठन की आम सभा की बैठक में होगी। दरअसल, अगले कार्यकाल की दावेदारी के लिए आवेदन की अंतिम तारीख 23 सितंबर थी।

news_articles: 'Star Trek' actor William Shatner, who became the oldest person to fly to space, responded to Prince William's criticism about "space tourism". Prince William said Earth should first be fixed instead of trying to find the next place to go. "He's...got the wrong idea," stated Shatner, adding that the efforts were first step in taking polluting industries off of Earth.A state park in US' Texas has shared a picture of a fish whose tongue was eaten by a parasite, and the parasite later replaced the organ. "This parasite detaches the fish's tongue, attaches itself to the fish's mouth, and becomes its tongue. The parasite then feeds on the fish's mucus," the Galveston Island State Park wrote.SpaceX's Crew Dragon spaceship faced a urine leak during its first private flight last month. According to William Gerstenmaier, a SpaceX vice-president, a tube came unglued during SpaceX's flight, spilling urine on to fans and beneath the floor. "We've fixed this problem in the tank by essentially making it an all-welded structure," Gerstenmaier said.A new micro snail species was found deep inside a limestone cave at Mawsmai village in Meghalaya's East Khasi Hills district. The discovery was made by Nipu Kumar Das and Aravind Madhyastha, scientists of the Bengaluru-based Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE). The new species was named 'Georissa mawsmaiensis' after the limestone cave in Mawsmai.An anonymous US collector bought the fossilised remains of 'Big John', the largest triceratops dinosaur ever discovered by paleontologists, for €6.65 million (almost ₹58 crore) at a Paris auction on Thursday. 'Big John' is named after the owner of the land where the dinosaur's bones were found. It roamed modern-day South Dakota more than 66 million years ago.La Nina, due to which temperature in North India is expected to fall to 3°C in January and February, is a phenomenon that is characterised by unusually cold ocean temperatures in the Equatorial Pacific. It forms when equatorial trade winds strengthen to bring colder, deep water up from the bottom of the sea, leading to below-normal temperatures in northern hemisphere.NASA astronaut Shane Kimbrough took to social media to share a picture of a racetrack taken from International Space Station. "Any guesses where this is? If you guessed southern Italy, you are correct!" he wrote in the caption. "It is the home to Porsche Engineering and the Nardo Technical Center," Kimbrough added.The Space Weather Prediction Center under the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) on Friday issued a G3 (strong) geomagnetic storm watch for October 30 following a massive X-class solar flare from the Sun on Thursday. A coronal mass ejection (an eruption of charged particles) from the flare could reach Earth by Saturday or Sunday, it said.Scientists from Nanjing Institute of Geology and Palaeontology have recently unearthed the fossil remains of a metre-long sea scorpion that is believed to have lived in China over 400 million years ago. The "dog-sized" scorpions named Terropterus xiushanensis, are believed to have been 16 times longer than the average-sized scorpions of today. They went extinct about 280 million years ago.Data from NASA's Juno spacecraft has revealed that Jupiter's Great Red Spot could be roughly 350-500 kilometres deep. "It's wide enough to swallow...Earth," Marzia Parisi, a Juno scientist from NASA JPL, said. An instrument called a microwave radiometer enabled scientists to peer beneath Jupiter's cloud tops and investigate the structure of its numerous vortex storms, including the Great Red Spot.Russian filmmaker Klim Shipenko, who has reportedly filmed the first movie in space, has said that the team is ready for a possible sequel on the Moon. Shipenko said that he believes space cinema should be filmed in space. "If it's about the Moon, let's go to the Moon, if it's Mars, let's go to Mars," the filmmaker added.Jeff Bezos-founded Blue Origin has unveiled plans to build a private space station that will operate as an "off-world mixed use business park". The planned station, called 'Orbital Reef', will be able to house up to 10 people and provide a place for commerce, research, tourism. The company plans to deploy the station by the end of this decade.Tokyo space startup Gitai Japan successfully conducted a technology demonstration of its AI-equipped autonomous robotic arm inside the space station last week. The robot carried out two common crew tasks, operating cables and switches, and assembling structures and panels. It was sent to orbit aboard a SpaceX Dragon capsule earlier in August.Japan's billionaire entrepreneur and Founder of custom-fit apparel brand ZOZO Yusaku Maezawa is training in Russia ahead of his visit to ISS in December as a space tourist. "I've been alive for 45 years and have not experienced anything like that," Maezawa said about experiencing zero gravity. Russian cosmonaut Alexander Misurkin will accompany Maezawa on his 12-day visit.US-based Verizon is partnering with Amazon to use its satellite internet system to offer rural broadband access in the US. Amazon's Project Kuiper, a network of 3,236 satellites, aims to offer high-speed internet globally. The firms will initially concentrate on expanding Verizon's LTE and 5G services using Amazon's Project Kuiper for backhaul, boosting coverage in areas with no high-speed data.SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said Starship could be ready for its first orbital launch attempt in November, pending regulatory approval. Earlier this week, SpaceX installed a Raptor vacuum engine and fired it up for the first time while connected to a Starship rocket. Starship is being developed to take people and cargo to the Moon and Mars.NASA has revealed that one of its newly launched spacecraft Lucy's 24-foot-wide solar panels may not be fully latched. It added that both of the solar arrays are producing power and charging the battery and the spacecraft is operating well and is stable. NASA launched Lucy on a 12-year journey on October 16 to explore Jupiter's Trojan asteroids.The ruins of almost 2,500 pre-Hispanic structures and 80 burial sites have been detected on just one-sixth of the route of the "Maya Train" project in Mexico. Mexico's National Institute of Anthropology and History described the ruins as being on the project's edge. The finds range from pottery and simple stone outlines of thatched pre-Hispanic Maya homes to ceremonial platforms.British scientists working in Ghana have photographed a giant owl, that has rarely been seen for 150 years, for the first time in African rainforests, Imperial College London said. Shelley's Eagle Owl was first described in 1872 from a specimen obtained in Ghana. Scientists said there have been no confirmed sightings of the owl from Ghana since the 1870s.Researchers led by Durham University have seen a white dwarf abruptly switching on and off for the first time. The white dwarf observed by the team is known to be accreting, or feeding, from an orbiting companion star. Astronomers saw it lose brightness in 30 minutes, a process which has earlier been observed to occur over several days to months.An international team of scientists have discovered the first dinosaur era crab fully preserved in amber, Harvard University reported. "The specimen is spectacular, it is one of a kind. It's absolutely complete and is not missing a single hair on the body, which is remarkable," a scientist said. The species has been named Cretapsara athanata.Aviation fuel derived from a type of mustard plant can replace petroleum-based fuel to reduce carbon emissions by up to 68%, University of Georgia scientist Puneet Dwivedi's study found. It also said producing sustainable aviation fuel from the non-edible oilseed crop costs $0.12-$1.28 per litre, whereas, petroleum-based aviation fuel costs higher when current economic incentives are accounted.Researchers may have detected the signs of a planet transiting a star outside of the Milky Way for the first time, NASA revealed. The possible exoplanet is located in a binary system 'M51-ULS-1' in Messier 51 galaxy. The system contains a black hole or neutron star orbiting a companion star with a mass about 20 times that of the Sun. NASA will be launching its uncrewed Artemis I mission to the Moon in February 2022. The mission was originally scheduled to launch in November, with astronauts set to land on the Moon by 2024. NASA has completed stacking the Orion spacecraft on top of the giant Space Launch System rocket. This mission is expected to last for a few weeks.

news_articles: The Indian Railways on Wednesday shared a post based on the Netflix series 'Squid Game' to convey COVID-19 appropriate behaviour habits to the citizens. In a Facebook post, Railways stated "3 rules to win the game against COVID-19" - vaccination, wearing mask in public places and frequent use of sanitiser. "How much money does the winner get?" a fan commented.America's famous 'Skinny House' in Boston, that's about 10 feet wide at its widest point and narrows in the back to about 9.25 feet, has been sold for $1.25 million (over ₹9.21 crore). The four-storey house built in 1862 is about 1,165 square feet (108 square metres). It has two bedrooms and one bathroom and includes a private deck.Danish artist Jens Haaning has pocketed 534,000 kroner (around ₹62 lakh) he received from a Denmark museum to incorporate into an artwork. When the museum received the promised artwork, the cash was missing from glass frames and the title had been changed to: "Take the Money And Run". "The work of art is that I took their money," Haaning said.A leave application of an engineer posted in Madhya Pradesh went viral after he asked for Sundays off to go door-to-door begging to erase his ego. Engineer Rajkumar Yadav said he had a realisation that the "soul is immortal". He also wrote that Asaduddin Owaisi was his friend in his past life and RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat was 'Shakuni Mama'.A five-year-old Motorola phone saved a man's life by stopping a bullet from penetrating his skin during an armed robbery in Brazil. The doctor, who treated the phone's owner, said the man only had a small bruise near his hip and was quickly discharged. He also shared pictures of the damaged Moto G5, which had a Hulk-themed phone cover.US-based FinanceBuzz has announced it will pay $1,300 (over ₹95,000) to an individual to become a 'Horror Movie Heart Rate Analyst' by watching 13 horror movies in 10 days. The candidate will be sent a fitness tracker to record heart rate while watching the films. FinanceBuzz wants to find out whether the size of a movie's budget impacts its effectiveness.An off-grid house right by the sea, with no internet or electricity, is up for sale in the UK's Devon with an asking price of £550,000 (over ₹5.5 crore). The two-bedroom house with 1,345 sq ft of interior space has no mains water supply and water is supplied by a rainwater harvesting system. Multi-fuel burners provide heating in the house.American rapper Doja Cat wore unique outfits while hosting the MTV Video Music Awards in New York. She was seen wearing a 'chair hat', a hat with a chair mounted on it, which the rapper later used for sitting. She was also seen in a pair of 'chicken feet' shoes and an outfit that made her look like a 'worm'.A couple in Canada used several boats to shift their two-storey house to a new location when they heard that it was about to be torn down. It took eight hours for the house to be moved to its new location. According to reports, it wasn't possible to move the house through land due to several obstacles, including high-voltage powerlines.A car parking space in the UK that has been described as "very rare" was sold for £115,000 (over ₹1.16 crore). The "good size" parking space is in a secure underground garage with an electric gate and lighting, the seller said. "The garage occupies a highly sought-after position, just a very short walk from shops, galleries and restaurants," it added.A woman has been banned from visiting a zoo in Belgium after she said she was having an "affair" with a chimpanzee. Adie Timmermans has been visiting the 38-year-old chimpanzee, Chita, for four years and the two used to blow kisses and wave at each other. The zoo said this wasn't good for Chita as other chimpanzees started excluding him.A video showing people fishing in Kolkata's waterlogged street has gone viral on social media. In the video, locals can be seen casting nets on the main road and catching hundreds of fish, which were reportedly distributed among the people in the area. Several areas in the city have been waterlogged due to heavy rains.A video that shows the staff of a London restaurant surprising a visually-impaired diner with an edible, braille 'Happy birthday' message went viral on TikTok with 8.7 million views in 24 hours. The text on the video read, "They had the chef write Happy Birthday in BRAILLE!!!...using melted chocolate." The 48-second clip has received over 25,000 comments. The video of a New York City Police Department (NYPD) officer jumping on to subway tracks to rescue an unconscious man as the train approaches was recently posted on Instagram. The cop was helped by a "good samaritan" and the duo were able to save the man who had fallen face-first on the tracks. The man reportedly had a seizure. A 25-foot rubber duck with the word "Joy" written on it mysteriously appeared in a harbour in Maine, US over the weekend. An official at the Belfast Harbour reportedly said it doesn't pose a navigational hazard and "everyone loves it". She added that she has no idea who owns it but "a lot of people" want to keep it there.A man in Senegal dressed as a woman to take his girlfriend's high school graduation exams because he feared she would not clear them. While he got away with it for three days, an invigilator noticed something strange about his appearance on the fourth day and handed him over to the police. He reportedly wore make-up, a headscarf and earrings. The video of a Chipotle employee in Baltimore, US throwing scissors at a customer who complained after his order was delayed by 20-30 minutes has gone viral on Facebook. The police is reportedly investigating the incident that occurred on August 10. The employee can be seen arguing with the customer in the video before hurling the scissors at him. A video of a 10-foot-long python slithering through the spice aisle of a local Australian supermarket was recently shared on Facebook. The supermarket said the snake was safely relocated by a former volunteer snake catcher who was present in the store during the incident. The snake catcher said the python was "mellow" and "almost...asking" to be taken outside. A Massachusetts woman who was wrongly convicted of witchcraft in 1693 and sentenced to death will likely be pardoned 328 years later, because of a group of eighth-graders. In 2020, students at a Massachusetts middle school began researching the conviction and the steps that would lead to her pardon. Consequently, a Democrat senator introduced a bill to clear her name. An 800-kg walrus called Wally will get a 'floating couch' after he sank two boats in Ireland while trying to climb on to them. The Seal Rescue Ireland (SRI) has appealed to the public to donate a 'floatation couch' like an unused pontoon for Wally to rest on. This will be placed in the harbour if Wally is spotted again.A Texas-based man recently won a $5.5 million (₹40.8 crore) lawsuit against a bar after getting into a drunken fight in the bar's parking lot in 2019. The lawsuit claimed the restaurant and bartender were negligent in their actions and allowed him to get "too drunk", leading to a fight. The man has previously been arrested for public intoxication. Pope Francis, a Buenos Aires' San Lorenzo football club fan, was recently gifted a new foosball table by representatives of a Tuscany-based table football association in Altopascio. Pope Francis also played a round when it was presented to him. The mayor of Altopascio in a Facebook post said the table was designed to be inclusive for people with physical disabilities. The fire department in Tulsa, Oklahoma took to Twitter to share that the "body in the river" they were called to investigate was a "man just laying in the water". The video in the post shows the man sitting up after firefighters approached him to check for signs of life. "Please...find alternate ways to stay cool!" the caption read. A US man inserted six kidney beans in his private parts as a "sex experiment" but was hospitalised when he couldn't "express the beans during ejaculation" as planned. He told doctors he had tried the sex act before but never used this many beans. The beans measured 15 millimetres by 7 millimetres and were removed from his urethra and bladder. Officials at a zoo in Florida recently announced the birth of two baby albino alligators in a Facebook video that has since gone viral online. The zookeepers in the video said that the newborns' parents, Blizzard and Snowflake, also gave birth to albino alligators last year, making them "back-to-back champions". "We're really excited," the officials added.

news_articles: Thousands of fans visited Bengaluru's Kanteerava Stadium on Friday to pay last respects to Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar, who passed away after a heart attack aged 46. Videos showed the stadium packed with thousands of fans. His last rites will be performed with full state honours, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said.West Bengal on Friday extended COVID-19 curbs till November 30 with more relaxations like the resumption of intra-state local trains at 50% capacity. Schools for classes 9-12, colleges and universities will reopen from November 16. Cinema halls, theatres, auditoriums, shopping malls, restaurants, spas and gyms can operate at 70% capacity. Essential government offices can open at 100% capacity.The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday banned sale and use of firecrackers amid COVID-19 in NCR and other cities having poor Air Quality Index, ahead of Diwali. In cities where AQI is in moderate category, only green crackers are allowed for two hours. During Christmas and New Year, green crackers can be burst in these cities from 11:55 pm-12:30 am.The eyes of late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar, who passed away aged 46 on Friday, have been donated to Narayana Nethralaya in Bengaluru by his family. The actor's father Dr Rajkumar's eyes were also donated in 2006. Often referred to as 'Power Star', Puneeth reportedly suffered a heart attack while he was working out at a gym on Friday morning.A huge traffic jam was noticed outside Arthur Road Jail on Friday as several people were seen gathered outside the jail. Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, who has been lodged in the jail, was supposed to be released on Friday evening. "Seeing the crowd...we informed the local police who deployed their officials for security reasons," added a prison official.All India Senior Selection Committee was in favour of sending Hardik Pandya back to India after a string of low scores in IPL 2021, reports said. However, it was Team India mentor MS Dhoni who backed Hardik Pandya to stay for his finishing skills, reports added. "You're playing an unfit guy who isn't useful to the team," a source said.Afghanistan's 23-year-old leg-spinner Rashid Khan has become the fastest bowler to take 100 wickets in T20I cricket history, taking 53 matches to reach the milestone. He achieved the feat after dismissing Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez in their T20 World Cup 2021 match today. He broke the record held by Lasith Malinga, who had taken 76 matches to reach 100 T20I wickets.Pakistan batsman Asif Ali smashed four sixes in 19th over to help Pakistan chase down the target of 148 against Afghanistan in 19 overs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 Group 2 match. Asif scored an unbeaten 25* off seven deliveries as Pakistan won the match by five wickets. Pakistan are on top of Group 2 with three victories.Bypolls to three Parliamentary constituencies of UT of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Madhya Pradesh and Himachal Pradesh will be held tomorrow, October 30. The bypolls to 30 Assembly seats spread across 14 states will also be held tomorrow. Voting will start from 7 am, while the counting of votes will take place on November 2.Singapore’s Indian-origin rapper Subhas Nair will be charged with four counts of attempting to promote feelings of ill will between different groups on grounds of religion and race. The Singapore Police Force while listing the four incidents included a "racially-charged" rap video published by him in 2019, which reportedly promoted feelings of ill will between the Chinese and other races. Actor Benedict Cumberbatch said that the bond between Doctor Strange and Peter Parker in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' has a "shade" of Tony Stark's relationship. However, he added that the relationship between the two (Doctor Strange and Spider-Man) is not as intimate as with Iron Man. He further said that Strange and Parker's relationship becomes "far more parental and corrective".Juhi Chawla, reacting to Aryan Khan's bail in the drugs case, said, "I'm...happy that it's all over and Aryan will come home very soon...I think it's a big relief for everybody." The actress on Friday signed bail surety of ₹1 lakh for Aryan at Mumbai Sessions Court. Aryan was detained by the NCB on October 2 and was later arrested. Emraan Hashmi said that he has always tried to do something "new and unique" for the audience in the movies. "I have always tried to...bring out some kind of novelty in my films," he said. Emraan added that his latest horror movie, 'Dybbuk', will give the audience an unforgettable experience.During his appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 13', Rajkummar Rao revealed that the show's host and veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan made a video for his mother after she passed away. He added that he played the video in front of his mother's picture. Rajkummar further said his mother was a big fan of Amitabh and wanted to meet him. England skipper Eoin Morgan said his side and Australia are the joint second favourites for T20 World Cup 2021 title. England will face Australia in Group 1 match on Saturday. "It's probably going to be one of our most difficult games. Australia are a very strong side, they've won two out of two, much like us...have started well," he added.Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said the India spinner has got a lot to offer and added he's very experienced. "Ashwin can play every single game [in T20 World Cup 2021]...they [team leadership] chose not to play him and that is on them," he added. Ashwin didn't play against Pakistan in India's opening match of the tournament.Pakistan batter Shoaib Malik said that being "underdogs" in the ongoing T20 World Cup is good for them as there is no pressure. "It's good to be the underdogs, there is no pressure on you and you can just go and give your best," he said. Malik added that lifting the T20 World Cup in 2009 was a great memory.David Warner scored 65(42) in Australia's win over Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup in UAE. "You've got to have a nice stable base on these wickets," Warner said. He added that the batter must wait for the ball during slower deliveries and "sit on it" if there is pace. Warner practised on synthetic wickets ahead of the match.World number one para-shuttler Pramod Bhagat said he won't rest on his laurels and continue to strive harder after being recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award. The 33-year-old won a gold medal in SL3 singles category at Tokyo Paralympics. Pramod was one of the 11 athletes who were nominated for country's highest sporting honour by the selection committee.World champion PV Sindhu entered the women's singles semi-finals of ongoing French Open after defeating Thailand's Busanan Ongbamrungphan 21-14, 21-14 on Friday. The third seeded Sindhu won her quarter-finals match in 38 minutes. She will now face unseeded Sayaka Takahashi of Japan. Earlier, India's Lakshya Sen lost to Heo Kwanghee of South Korea 17-21, 15-21 in men's singles quarter-finals.BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav alleged the party's MP Varun Gandhi has been speaking against BJP's policies, adding, "it's not appropriate for him to do". Yadav said, "It looks like...[he's] feeling uncomfortable with BJP." This comes after Gandhi on Friday said the farmers would continue to be exploited in mandis till there is no legal guarantee for MSPs of crops.The US on Friday urged Sudan's military to refrain from violence against protesters ahead of planned demonstrations on Saturday opposing the coup. A similar appeal was made by UN chief Antonio Guterres who urged the military "not to create any more victims". At least 11 protesters have been killed in clashes with security forces since the military coup on Monday.UK's Queen Elizabeth II has been advised by her doctors to rest for at least the next two weeks, Buckingham Palace said on Friday. She has also been advised to avoid official visits and only undertake light, desk-based duties during this time, it added. Notably, this comes after the Queen spent a night in the hospital last week.US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron met for the first time since tensions between the two countries rose over a secret American-British nuclear submarine deal with Australia. "What we did was clumsy," Biden said, adding the deal "was not done with a lot of grace". "I was under...impression that France had been informed long before," he added.Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday said that Ukraine's use of Turkish drones to carry out a strike in the conflict in the eastern Donbass region is defensive and does not violate any agreements. Russia accused Ukraine of destabilising the situation after government forces used a Turkish-made drone to strike a position controlled by Russian-backed separatists this week.

news_articles: Thousands of fans visited Bengaluru's Kanteerava Stadium on Friday to pay last respects to Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar, who passed away after a heart attack aged 46. Videos showed the stadium packed with thousands of fans. His last rites will be performed with full state honours, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said.Pictures have surfaced online on Friday, showing Shah Rukh Khan's home 'Mannat' getting decorated with lights ahead of Aryan Khan's release from jail. Aryan was granted bail by Bombay High Court in Mumbai cruise drugs case on Thursday and is likely to walk out of jail on Saturday. Several fans also gathered outside Shah Rukh's house.PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar who passed away aged 46 today due to heart attack. "A cruel twist of fate has snatched away from us a prolific and talented actor, Puneeth Rajkumar. This was no age to go. The coming generations will remember him fondly for his works and wonderful personality," PM Modi said.A huge traffic jam was noticed outside Arthur Road Jail on Friday as several people were seen gathered outside the jail. Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, who has been lodged in the jail, was supposed to be released on Friday evening. "Seeing the crowd...we informed the local police who deployed their officials for security reasons," added a prison official.Aryan Khan will not walk out of jail today as the jail's deadline for document submission has passed. Nitin Waychal, Arthur Road Jail Superintendent, said, "A physical copy of the release order has to be put into the bail box outside Arthur Road Jail for the release." "The jail officials wait until 5:35 pm for this," he added. The eyes of late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar, who passed away aged 46 on Friday, have been donated to Narayana Nethralaya in Bengaluru by his family. The actor's father Dr Rajkumar's eyes were also donated in 2006. Often referred to as 'Power Star', Puneeth reportedly suffered a heart attack while he was working out at a gym on Friday morning.Actress Juhi Chawla reached Mumbai Sessions Court on Friday along with other lawyers to complete all formalities regarding Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan's release. She reached the court to sign bail surety of ₹1 lakh for Aryan. "She knows Aryan since his birth since his father and Juhi are professionally associated," advocate Satish Maneshinde said to court.Actor Piyush Mishra, on being asked about his reaction to Aryan Khan's bail, said, "What will be my reaction? He did it, he got bail." "Shah Rukh Khan, his son or...Sameer Wankhede know better. What do I have to do with it?" Shah Rukh's 'Dil Se' co-star added. "You reap what you sow. Handle your children, that's it," Mishra stated. According to documents obtained by TMZ, Zayn Malik was at his and Gigi Hadid's home on September 29 when he got into an argument and called Gigi's mother Yolanda a "f***ing Dutch s**t" and told her to "stay away from [my] f***ing daughter". He allegedly "shoved her into a dresser". Zayn was reportedly charged with four criminal offences of harassment.In an apparent dig at NCB's Sameer Wankhede, Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik said, "The man who was doing everything to ensure that Aryan Khan and others are not given bail, was knocking the court's door yesterday." "Situation has completely changed in a month," Malik added. This comes after Bombay High Court disposed of Wankhede's plea seeking interim protection from arrest.Emraan Hashmi said that he has always tried to do something "new and unique" for the audience in the movies. "I have always tried to...bring out some kind of novelty in my films," he said. Emraan added that his latest horror movie, 'Dybbuk', will give the audience an unforgettable experience.R Madhavan took to Twitter on Friday to mourn the demise of Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar. He wrote, "GONE - one of our KINDEST, NICEST AND NOBLE soul." "I don't know what I'm feeling. I'm feeling so devastated. Brother you've left us very confused and heartbroken," he said, adding, "The heavens are brighter today. I'm still hoping this isn't true." 'Friends' star Matthew Perry is writing an autobiography, which will be published in 2022. The book will reportedly take the "readers behind-the-scenes and onto the soundstage of the most successful sitcom of all time while opening up about his private struggles with addiction". It has been described as 'candid, self-aware' and 'unflinchingly honest' but also funny. Taking to Twitter on Friday, Dhanush condoled the demise of Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar and wrote, "Puneeth my friend. This is so heartbreaking." "Rest in peace my friend. Hope you're in a better place...My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends and fans," he added. Puneeth, who starred in 'Rana Vikrama' and 'Raajakumara', passed away aged 46 due to heart attack. Actor Benedict Cumberbatch said that the bond between Doctor Strange and Peter Parker in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' has a "shade" of Tony Stark's relationship. However, he added that the relationship between the two (Doctor Strange and Spider-Man) is not as intimate as with Iron Man. He further said that Strange and Parker's relationship becomes "far more parental and corrective".Nawazuddin Siddiqui has said he'll not be doing any more web series. The 'Sacred Games' actor added that the platform has become a "dumping ground" for "redundant shows". "It's become dhanda (racket) for big production houses and actors who are now so-called stars on the OTT platform...Producers get whopping amounts to create unlimited content. Quantity has killed quality," he said. Actress Gemma Chan, who played 'Minn-Erva' in 'Captain Marvel', will portray the role of 'Sersi' in the upcoming Marvel Studios' movie, 'Eternals'. Chan revealed that she was "surprised" to play a second character in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). "I was not expected to be back. But yeah, I was pleasantly surprised," she said. During his appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 13', Rajkummar Rao revealed that the show's host and veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan made a video for his mother after she passed away. He added that he played the video in front of his mother's picture. Rajkummar further said his mother was a big fan of Amitabh and wanted to meet him. Following the death of Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar, hundreds of fans gathered outside Bengaluru's Vikram Hospital on Friday, where Puneeth was brought in after he suffered heart attack. Meanwhile, Bengaluru City Police said the situation in the city is under control, adding, "[Don't] believe in any rumours." A high alert has also reportedly been declared in Karnataka following Puneeth's death.Actor Ryan Reynolds said that he is "embracing" the break from movie-making. Reynolds revealed that his habit of "fixating on things" caused him anxiety. "My goal is to be as present as I can be and not just tick a box just to do it. I'm fully embracing and living that right now," he said. Pooja Bedi has said what happened to Aryan Khan is "deeply unfortunate". "Punishment should always be in proportion to crime committed. Aryan has been punished in undue proportion," she added. Pooja also criticised all those who targeted Aryan, and said, "Shame on everyone who participated in this mob-mentality attack on him. Celebrities' kids are human beings, just like everyone else."As her film 'Fashion' completed 13 years of release on Friday, Mugdha Godse said people understood what goes behind the fashion industry through the film. She added there were a lot of myths, confusion and prejudices about the industry until then. "[People] understood...what fashion world is all about. It's not a cakewalk that [everyone] thought it to be," said Mugdha. Kit Harington, speaking about reuniting with 'Game of Thrones' actor Richard Madden in 'Eternals', said, "We had a big hug." He added that they've been close friends for a long time. "We had a shared experience of 'Game of Thrones' in the first three seasons where it sort of blew up and became this Goliath of a show," Kit said.  Juhi Chawla, reacting to Aryan Khan's bail in the drugs case, said, "I'm...happy that it's all over and Aryan will come home very soon...I think it's a big relief for everybody." The actress on Friday signed bail surety of ₹1 lakh for Aryan at Mumbai Sessions Court. Aryan was detained by the NCB on October 2 and was later arrested. Manoj Bajpayee spoke about how his family reacted to his show 'The Family Man' and said, "Both Shabana (wife) and Ava Nayla (daughter) have loved the show." He added that Shabana is "brutally honest" when she reviews his films and performances. "If she doesn't like something, she will critique me extremely honestly for it. But I like that," Manoj said.

news_articles: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard left the pitch after scoring eight runs off 16 deliveries in the 14th over against Bangladesh in the T20 World Cup 2021 match on Friday. Several fans and ex-players speculated that he left the pitch as a strategy. However, he returned to bat after West Indies lost their seventh wicket in the last over.All India Senior Selection Committee was in favour of sending Hardik Pandya back to India after a string of low scores in IPL 2021, reports said. However, it was Team India mentor MS Dhoni who backed Hardik Pandya to stay for his finishing skills, reports added. "You're playing an unfit guy who isn't useful to the team," a source said.West Indies defeated Bangladesh by three runs to register their first victory in T20 World Cup 2021. Bangladesh have now lost three matches in a row and are placed last on the Super 12 Group 1 points table. Meanwhile, West Indies are placed fifth on the points table with one win from three matches.Pakistan batsman Asif Ali smashed four sixes in 19th over to help Pakistan chase down the target of 148 against Afghanistan in 19 overs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 Group 2 match. Asif scored an unbeaten 25* off seven deliveries as Pakistan won the match by five wickets. Pakistan are on top of Group 2 with three victories.Ahead of T20 World Cup Afghanistan-Pakistan match, leg-spinner Rashid Khan said, "It's always a good game against Pakistan...but this should remain as a game." He added, "I request all fans to stay cool and calm...and just enjoy the game. What happened in 2019 shouldn't have happened." During 2019 World Cup, Pakistan and Afghanistan fans clashed with each other in stands.Ellidy Pullin, the partner of Australian Olympic snowboarder Alex "Chumpy" Pullin, has given birth to their daughter 15 months after his death. "Our girl, born 25th October 2021. Minnie Alex Pullin," she announced on social media. Earlier, Ellidy had revealed that she conceived via IVF after a doctor secured healthy sperm from Chumpy's body in the days after his death.Afghanistan's 23-year-old leg-spinner Rashid Khan has become the fastest bowler to take 100 wickets in T20I cricket history, taking 53 matches to reach the milestone. He achieved the feat after dismissing Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez in their T20 World Cup 2021 match today. He broke the record held by Lasith Malinga, who had taken 76 matches to reach 100 T20I wickets.Shoaib Akhtar, who walked off live TV show on PTV News after being called rude by host Nauman Niaz, reacted to channel's remark that they've taken him and Niaz off air. Akhtar said, "Well...that's hilarious. I resigned in front of 220 million Pakistanis and billions across the world. Is PTV crazy or what? Who are they to off air me?"Commentator Aakash Chopra said Afghanistan should go for an all-out attack with their in-form spin bowlers ahead of their T20 World Cup Group 2 match against Pakistan. "Open...bowling with Mujeeb Ur Rahman. Yes, Mohammad Rizwan thrashed Varun Chakravarthy but I don't think he can do the same against Rahman...bring Rashid Khan to strangle Pakistani batters in middle overs," he added.David Warner scored 65(42) in Australia's win over Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup in UAE. "You've got to have a nice stable base on these wickets," Warner said. He added that the batter must wait for the ball during slower deliveries and "sit on it" if there is pace. Warner practised on synthetic wickets ahead of the match.After South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock's withdrawal from T20 World Cup 2021 match on Tuesday due to his stand on 'Black Lives Matter' movement, teammate Rassie van der Dussen said the team will welcome him back with open arms. "Quinny is one of the best players in the world...if he's selected...he'll come back like nothing ever happened," he added.Ex-Sri Lanka spinner Muttiah Muralitharan said Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2021 remind him a little bit of Sri Lanka when they won the World Cup in 1996 since the team had "a lot of experienced batters and some promising young bowlers". He added, "Same is true for Afghanistan...you have Mohammad Nabi...some young batters - Hazratullah Zazai and Rahmanullah Gurbaz."Australia will continue playing four specialist pacers in T20 World Cup with their all-rounders playing the role of a fifth bowler, vice-captain Pat Cummins said. He added that the current composition of the team gives them a huge flexibility. All-rounders Glenn Maxwell and Marcus Stoinis conceded a combined 51 runs from their four wicketless overs against Sri Lanka on Thursday.Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said the India spinner has got a lot to offer and added he's very experienced. "Ashwin can play every single game [in T20 World Cup 2021]...they [team leadership] chose not to play him and that is on them," he added. Ashwin didn't play against Pakistan in India's opening match of the tournament.Ahead of India-New Zealand T20 World Cup 2021 Group 2 match, New Zealand pacer Adam Milne said he's excited to hopefully make a difference with the ball in the tournament. Milne wasn't originally included in the main squad. However, Lockie Ferguson's injury which ruled him out of the World Cup made way for Milne in the team.Pakistan batter Shoaib Malik said that being "underdogs" in the ongoing T20 World Cup is good for them as there is no pressure. "It's good to be the underdogs, there is no pressure on you and you can just go and give your best," he said. Malik added that lifting the T20 World Cup in 2009 was a great memory.England skipper Eoin Morgan said his side and Australia are the joint second favourites for T20 World Cup 2021 title. England will face Australia in Group 1 match on Saturday. "It's probably going to be one of our most difficult games. Australia are a very strong side, they've won two out of two, much like us...have started well," he added.Ahead of India-New Zealand T20 World Cup 2021 Group 2 match, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that India need spinners who are looking to take wickets. "Any spinner who bowls to get wickets and not obsess over the economy is my guy," he added. Spinners Varun Chakaravarthy and Ravindra Jadeja were 0/33 and 0/28 in India's 10-wicket defeat against Pakistan.Abhay Sharma has applied for the position of Team India's fielding coach. R Sridhar's tenure as the fielding coach for the men's team will end in November. Previously, Abhay has worked as the fielding coach of India A and the U-19 teams. He has also been the fielding coach for the Indian women's team.World number one para-shuttler Pramod Bhagat said he won't rest on his laurels and continue to strive harder after being recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award. The 33-year-old won a gold medal in SL3 singles category at Tokyo Paralympics. Pramod was one of the 11 athletes who were nominated for country's highest sporting honour by the selection committee.Following defending champions West Indies' two straight losses in T20 World Cup 2021 Group 1, ex-captain Daren Sammy said that it doesn't mean they are out of the tournament. "We are all disappointed. The World Cup has not started the way we wanted to," he added. West Indies will face Bangladesh in their third match on Friday in Sharjah.Ex-Australia captain Greg Chappell recalled the 2018 sandpaper gate and said, "There was a period leading up to Cape Town where quite a few of us had the same feeling." "We couldn’t tell...what the blow-up was going to be, but we knew...something ominous was around the corner," he added. "Every one of us in the organisation was guilty," Chappell stated.World champion PV Sindhu entered the women's singles semi-finals of ongoing French Open after defeating Thailand's Busanan Ongbamrungphan 21-14, 21-14 on Friday. The third seeded Sindhu won her quarter-finals match in 38 minutes. She will now face unseeded Sayaka Takahashi of Japan. Earlier, India's Lakshya Sen lost to Heo Kwanghee of South Korea 17-21, 15-21 in men's singles quarter-finals.Former Manchester United player Paul Parker has opined that midfielder Bruno Fernandes has been manipulated by Cristiano Ronaldo's return. "Bruno has allowed himself to be mentally bullied out of doing all the good things he was doing before," Parker said. Paul added that Fernandes is unable to perform because he "feels he's got to deliver to Ronaldo". Australia captain Aaron Finch said that teammate Adam Zampa, who registered bowling figures of 4-0-12-2 in his side's seven-wicket win against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup Group 1 match, showed a "world-class performance". He added, "Sri Lanka got off to a flier. But Zampa dragged it back and then Mitchell Starc." Zampa was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

news_articles: West Bengal on Friday extended COVID-19 curbs till November 30 with more relaxations like the resumption of intra-state local trains at 50% capacity. Schools for classes 9-12, colleges and universities will reopen from November 16. Cinema halls, theatres, auditoriums, shopping malls, restaurants, spas and gyms can operate at 70% capacity. Essential government offices can open at 100% capacity.The Bengaluru police has announced a ban on alcohol sale in Bengaluru with immediate effect till October 31 midnight after the demise of actor Puneeth Rajkumar. Several shops, offices and pubs were also closed down in the city to pay tribute to the actor. The Kannada actor passed away in Bengaluru after suffering a heart attack earlier in the day. Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Friday said the barricades were being removed from farmers' protest sites at Tikri and Ghazipur borders to create a positive atmosphere. He added that this move will help the general public as barricades affected interstate travel. Further, he claimed Delhi Police is prepared to handle any law and order situation that may arise. The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday banned sale and use of firecrackers amid COVID-19 in NCR and other cities having poor Air Quality Index, ahead of Diwali. In cities where AQI is in moderate category, only green crackers are allowed for two hours. During Christmas and New Year, green crackers can be burst in these cities from 11:55 pm-12:30 am.The Jharkhand High Court on Friday criticised CBI probe into the alleged murder of Dhanbad Additional District Judge Uttam Anand, saying the investigation "still remains where it started". A lawyer said HC found no difference between the CBI probe and one conducted by state police. CBI filed the charge sheet without clarifying the motive of the murder, HC added.The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Friday further eased COVID-19 restrictions and allowed full-seating capacity in cinema halls, theatres and multiplexes from Monday (November 1). It also raised the number of people attending wedding functions and funerals from 100 to 200 and authorised weekly markets in the city to reopen from Monday. In an apparent dig at NCB's Sameer Wankhede, Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik said, "The man who was doing everything to ensure that Aryan Khan and others are not given bail, was knocking the court's door yesterday." "Situation has completely changed in a month," Malik added. This comes after Bombay High Court disposed of Wankhede's plea seeking interim protection from arrest.Bypolls to three Parliamentary constituencies of UT of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Madhya Pradesh and Himachal Pradesh will be held tomorrow, October 30. The bypolls to 30 Assembly seats spread across 14 states will also be held tomorrow. Voting will start from 7 am, while the counting of votes will take place on November 2.The Supreme Court on Friday said that there was no total ban on firecrackers' use and only those crackers that are harmful to the health of citizens are banned. Asserting that crackers with barium salts are prohibited, SC said, "Celebration cannot be at the cost of others' health." It directed states/UTs to strictly implement a ban on harmful crackers.As many as 418 people died by suicide daily in 2020 in India, as per a National Crime Records Bureau report. A total of 1,53,052 suicides were recorded in India last year as compared to 1,39,123 suicides in the country in 2019, NCRB data showed. The maximum number of suicides were recorded in Maharashtra (19,909), followed by Tamil Nadu (16,883).Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is in Rome for the G20 Summit, was greeted by several people at Piazza Gandhi on Friday. In a video, a person can be heard shouting "Narendra bhai kem chho (How are you)?" in Gujarati. "Maja ma chho (I am fine)," PM Modi replied while he was talking to a man in Gujarati.The ban on scheduled international commercial passenger flights to and from India has been extended till November 30, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Friday. The restriction will not apply to international all-cargo operations and flights specifically approved by DGCA, it said. The ban, placed amid COVID-19, was earlier extended till October 31.Former J&K CM and NC leader Omar Abdullah on Friday criticised behaviour of lawyers in Agra towards three Kashmiri students who were arrested for allegedly celebrating Pakistan's win over India in the T20 World Cup. He was referring to reports that Kashmiri students were heckled while coming out of court. "The role of the police is deeply (suspected)," he tweeted.Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said the three agricultural laws will also be revoked just like the barricades were removed from farmers' protest site. "Hail Annadata Satyagraha," he tweeted in Hindi. Earlier, Delhi Police began removing the barricades and concertina wires installed in Ghazipur. "The temporary barricading is being removed to ease out vehicular movement," an officer said.Addressing TMC workers in Goa on Friday, West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said BJP calls her "anti-Hindu, but they're no one to give her character certificate". Banerjee said TMC doesn't divide people on the basis of religion, adding, "We unite people". She added the three letters in her party name, TMC, stand for temple, mosque and church.BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav alleged the party's MP Varun Gandhi has been speaking against BJP's policies, adding, "it's not appropriate for him to do". Yadav said, "It looks like...[he's] feeling uncomfortable with BJP." This comes after Gandhi on Friday said the farmers would continue to be exploited in mandis till there is no legal guarantee for MSPs of crops.Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday addressed the launch event of ''Mera Parivaar-BJP Parivaar'' membership drive in Uttar Pradesh. During the event, Shah said, "If you want to make [Narendra Modi] PM again in 2024, make [Yogi Adityanath] the [CM of Uttar Pradesh] again in 2022." "Without Uttar Pradesh, there cannot be a government at the Centre," he added.Three people who were arrested for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans during the Eid Milad-un-Nabi procession in Noida this month were booked for sedition. The accused, Mohammad Zafar, Samir Ali and Ali Raza, were arrested on basis of a social media video. The sedition charge was invoked against them after right-wing activists protested outside a police station demanding the same.Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has written to Karnataka State Pollution Control Board seeking action against the Bengaluru sewerage board (BWSSB). BBMP officials said the sewerage board failed to prevent the entry of sewage into lakes. According to the CAG report, out of the 1,440 MLD sewage generated in BBMP area, about 780 MLD was discharged into stormwater drains without treatment.The 40th edition of the India International Trade Fair (IITF) will begin from November 14 at New Delhi's Pragati Maidan and will conclude on November 27. The theme of the fair will be 'AatmaNirbhar Bharat'. Over 2,000 exhibitors from India and other countries are expected to participate in the fair. Notably, the fair wasn't held last year amid COVID-19 pandemic.At least five people died and several fell sick after consuming liquor in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district. As per police, four people died in the hospital while the body of the fifth person was recovered from near his house in Rupauli village. Two people, including a member of the local panchayat samiti, have been arrested in connection to the case.Delhi High Court has ordered there'll be a complete resumption of physical hearings in the Delhi High Court and District Courts from November 22. Courts will allow hybrid hearings or hearings through video conferencing at the request of any party or their counsel. The existing mechanism of limited physical hearings will continue in the Delhi High Court till November 18.Rajendra Kale, who was driving the BEST bus that rammed into a dumper truck on Wednesday in Mumbai's Dadar area, died on Friday. Kale, 52, was undergoing treatment at Sion Hospital after being severely injured. Three injured persons, including the bus conductor, are in critical condition. A video showed the bus hitting the dumper truck from behind.A 25-year-old Pune-based woman was stabbed to death in Jaipur by a man from Maharashtra last Friday for allegedly abandoning him after 'marriage'. The accused, Mahesh Bhaskar Thackeray, killed the woman five days ago in Sanganer after following her for weeks. Mahesh claimed that he got married to the woman in 2020, but she left him soon after their marriage.
