news_articles: Kit Harington, speaking about reuniting with 'Game of Thrones' actor Richard Madden in 'Eternals', said, "We had a big hug." He added that they've been close friends for a long time. "We had a shared experience of 'Game of Thrones' in the first three seasons where it sort of blew up and became this Goliath of a show," Kit said.
title: We'd a big hug: Kit on reuniting with GoT actor Richard in Eternals | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

news_articles: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry is writing an autobiography, which will be published in 2022. The book will reportedly take the "readers behind-the-scenes and onto the soundstage of the most successful sitcom of all time while opening up about his private struggles with addiction". It has been described as 'candid, self-aware' and 'unflinchingly honest' but also funny.
title: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry to release autobiography next year | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

news_articles: The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Friday further eased COVID-19 restrictions and allowed full-seating capacity in cinema halls, theatres and multiplexes from Monday (November 1). It also raised the number of people attending wedding functions and funerals from 100 to 200 and authorised weekly markets in the city to reopen from Monday.
title: Delhi allows 100% capacity in cinemas, 200 guests at weddings from Monday | National News | Inshorts
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

news_articles: West Indies defeated Bangladesh by three runs to register their first victory in T20 World Cup 2021. Bangladesh have now lost three matches in a row and are placed last on the Super 12 Group 1 points table. Meanwhile, West Indies are placed fifth on the points table with one win from three matches.
title: West Indies register their 1st win of T20 WC 2021, B'desh lose 3rd match in a row | Sports News | Inshorts
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

news_articles: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard left the pitch after scoring eight runs off 16 deliveries in the 14th over against Bangladesh in the T20 World Cup 2021 match on Friday. Several fans and ex-players speculated that he left the pitch as a strategy. However, he returned to bat after West Indies lost their seventh wicket in the last over.
title: Kieron Pollard leaves pitch after scoring 8 runs off 16 balls, comes back to bat later | Sports News | Inshorts
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

news_articles: After South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock's withdrawal from T20 World Cup 2021 match on Tuesday due to his stand on 'Black Lives Matter' movement, teammate Rassie van der Dussen said the team will welcome him back with open arms. "Quinny is one of the best players in the world...if he's selected...he'll come back like nothing ever happened," he added.
title: South Africa will welcome De Kock back with open arms: Van der Dussen | T20_World_Cup News | Inshorts
author: Anant KaurAnant Kaur

news_articles: Ahead of T20 World Cup Afghanistan-Pakistan match, leg-spinner Rashid Khan said, "It's always a good game against Pakistan...but this should remain as a game." He added, "I request all fans to stay cool and calm...and just enjoy the game. What happened in 2019 shouldn't have happened." During 2019 World Cup, Pakistan and Afghanistan fans clashed with each other in stands.
title: Request fans to stay cool, Afghanistan-Pak match should remain as a game: Rashid | Sports News | Inshorts
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

news_articles: Pope Francis has urged world leaders to provide "effective responses" to tackle climate change and offer "concrete hope" to future generations when they meet at the UN climate summit, COP26. Pope Francis called for a "renewed sense of shared responsibility for our world" to spur action. The climate summit will be held from October 31 to November 12 in Glasgow.
title: COP26 climate summit must offer concrete hope to future generations: Pope | World News | Inshorts
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

news_articles: Rajinikanth was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital following an episode of giddiness, the hospital said in a statement. "He was thoroughly evaluated and was advised to undergo Carotid Artery revascularization. The procedure was performed successfully today," it added. Rajinikanth is likely to be discharged from the hospital after a few days, the statement further read.
title: Rajinikanth undergoes surgery, likely to be discharged soon | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

news_articles: Dubai [UAE], October 29 (ANI): Australia skipper Aaron Finch lavished praise on spinner Adam Zampa following his team's win over Sri Lanka in the ongoing T20 World Cup.David Warner smashed his first half-century in the ongoing T20 World as Australia defeated Sri Lanka by seven wickets in the Super 12 match of Group 1 on Thursday.Zampa picked two wickets and gave just 12 runs as Sri Lanka was restricted to 154 in the 20 overs.  "That was a really good performance. Sri Lanka got off to a flier. But Zampa dragged it back, and then Starc. We felt it was a really good wicket and to chase that down was nice," Finch told the host broadcaster Star Sports after the match."When you're looking at the impact on the game, Zamps was terrific tonight. He was fantastic, got big wickets. That was a world-class performance from him," he added.Chasing 155, Finch and Warner put on the biggest powerplay score (63) of the ongoing T20 World Cup as Australia got off to a flying start."When the ball was flying around it felt like they were going at 15 an over, but you look up and it was 8 an over. Nice when you get a couple in the middle of the bat early. Knew that we had to take a chance against the quicks early on, with the spinners coming in later," said Finch.Australia will next play against England on Saturday. Speaking about the game, Finch said, "Always a great battle (England) no matter the format." (ANI)
title: T20 WC: Finch hails 'terrific' Adam Zampa following Australia's win

news_articles: A 25-year-old Pune-based woman was stabbed to death in Jaipur by a man from Maharashtra last Friday for allegedly abandoning him after 'marriage'. The accused, Mahesh Bhaskar Thackeray, killed the woman five days ago in Sanganer after following her for weeks. Mahesh claimed that he got married to the woman in 2020, but she left him soon after their marriage.
title: Pune woman killed in Jaipur by man following her from Maharashtra | National News | Inshorts
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

news_articles: Australia will continue playing four specialist pacers in T20 World Cup with their all-rounders playing the role of a fifth bowler, vice-captain Pat Cummins said. He added that the current composition of the team gives them a huge flexibility. All-rounders Glenn Maxwell and Marcus Stoinis conceded a combined 51 runs from their four wicketless overs against Sri Lanka on Thursday.
title: All-rounders to shoulder Aus' 5th bowler's role in T20 WC: Cummins | T20_World_Cup News | Inshorts
author: Anant KaurAnant Kaur

news_articles: The Bengaluru police has announced a ban on alcohol sale in Bengaluru with immediate effect till October 31 midnight after the demise of actor Puneeth Rajkumar. Several shops, offices and pubs were also closed down in the city to pay tribute to the actor. The Kannada actor passed away in Bengaluru after suffering a heart attack earlier in the day.
title: Alcohol sale banned in B'luru till Oct 31 after Puneeth Rajkumar's death | National News | Inshorts
author: Ridham GambhirRidham Gambhir

news_articles: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Friday declared the results of the civil services Prelims 2021 exam that was held on October 10. Candidates can check their results on the official website upsc.gov.in. The exam was earlier scheduled to be held on June 27 but was postponed due to a rise in COVID-19 cases.
title: UPSC declares results of civil services Prelims exam 2021 | Education News | Inshorts
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

news_articles: Former Manchester United player Paul Parker has opined that midfielder Bruno Fernandes has been manipulated by Cristiano Ronaldo's return. "Bruno has allowed himself to be mentally bullied out of doing all the good things he was doing before," Parker said. Paul added that Fernandes is unable to perform because he "feels he's got to deliver to Ronaldo".
title: Man Utd's Bruno has been manipulated by Ronaldo's return: Parker | Sports News | Inshorts
author: Amartya SharmaAmartya Sharma

news_articles: Ex-Australia captain Greg Chappell recalled the 2018 sandpaper gate and said, "There was a period leading up to Cape Town where quite a few of us had the same feeling." "We couldn’t tell...what the blow-up was going to be, but we knew...something ominous was around the corner," he added. "Every one of us in the organisation was guilty," Chappell stated.
title: Knew something ominous was around the corner: Chappell on sandpaper gate | Sports News | Inshorts
author: Amartya SharmaAmartya Sharma

news_articles: Rajendra Kale, who was driving the BEST bus that rammed into a dumper truck on Wednesday in Mumbai's Dadar area, died on Friday. Kale, 52, was undergoing treatment at Sion Hospital after being severely injured. Three injured persons, including the bus conductor, are in critical condition. A video showed the bus hitting the dumper truck from behind.
title: Driver of bus, that rammed into dumper truck in Mumbai's Dadar, dies | National News | Inshorts
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

news_articles: Three people who were arrested for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans during the Eid Milad-un-Nabi procession in Noida this month were booked for sedition. The accused, Mohammad Zafar, Samir Ali and Ali Raza, were arrested on basis of a social media video. The sedition charge was invoked against them after right-wing activists protested outside a police station demanding the same.
title: 3 arrested for raising pro-Pak slogans in Noida booked for sedition | National News | Inshorts
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

news_articles: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is in Rome for the G20 Summit, was greeted by several people at Piazza Gandhi on Friday. In a video, a person can be heard shouting "Narendra bhai kem chho (How are you)?" in Gujarati. "Maja ma chho (I am fine)," PM Modi replied while he was talking to a man in Gujarati.
title: 'Maja ma chho,' replies PM Modi on being asked 'Narendra bhai kem chho' in Rome | National News | Inshorts
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

news_articles: The new leader of the insurgent group Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), Malam Bako, was killed in a military operation this month, the Nigerian Army said on Thursday. This comes two weeks after it announced the death of the group's former head Abu Musab al-Barnawi. ISWAP had split from rival Boko Haram in 2016.
title: Islamic State leader in West Africa Province killed: Nigerian Army | World News | Inshorts
author: ShaileshShailesh

news_articles: The ban on scheduled international commercial passenger flights to and from India has been extended till November 30, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Friday. The restriction will not apply to international all-cargo operations and flights specifically approved by DGCA, it said. The ban, placed amid COVID-19, was earlier extended till October 31.
title: India extends ban on international passenger flights till November 30 | National News | Inshorts
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

news_articles: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Friday said the barricades were being removed from farmers' protest sites at Tikri and Ghazipur borders to create a positive atmosphere. He added that this move will help the general public as barricades affected interstate travel. Further, he claimed Delhi Police is prepared to handle any law and order situation that may arise.
title: Want to create positive atmosphere: Delhi Police chief on removing barricades | National News | Inshorts
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

news_articles: In an apparent dig at NCB's Sameer Wankhede, Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik said, "The man who was doing everything to ensure that Aryan Khan and others are not given bail, was knocking the court's door yesterday." "Situation has completely changed in a month," Malik added. This comes after Bombay High Court disposed of Wankhede's plea seeking interim protection from arrest.
title: Man who tried to prevent Aryan's bail is now knocking court's door: Malik on Wankhede | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

news_articles: As many as 418 people died by suicide daily in 2020 in India, as per a National Crime Records Bureau report. A total of 1,53,052 suicides were recorded in India last year as compared to 1,39,123 suicides in the country in 2019, NCRB data showed. The maximum number of suicides were recorded in Maharashtra (19,909), followed by Tamil Nadu (16,883).
title: India saw 418 suicides daily last year, Maha recorded maximum suicide deaths | National News | Inshorts
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

news_articles: Belarus' Interior Ministry on Friday classified NEXTA news outlet's three Telegram Messenger channels as "extremist" organisations. People subscribing to them can now face up to seven years in prison. This comes after social media was widely used to coordinate demonstrations and share footage of a violent police crackdown during mass street protests against President Alexander Lukashenko in 2020.
title: Belarus classifies 3 Telegram channels as 'extremist' organisations | World News | Inshorts
author: ShaileshShailesh

news_articles: Actor Ryan Reynolds said that he is "embracing" the break from movie-making. Reynolds revealed that his habit of "fixating on things" caused him anxiety. "My goal is to be as present as I can be and not just tick a box just to do it. I'm fully embracing and living that right now," he said.
title: Fixating on things caused anxiety: Ryan on taking break from films | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Amartya SharmaAmartya Sharma

news_articles: Delhi High Court has ordered there'll be a complete resumption of physical hearings in the Delhi High Court and District Courts from November 22. Courts will allow hybrid hearings or hearings through video conferencing at the request of any party or their counsel. The existing mechanism of limited physical hearings will continue in the Delhi High Court till November 18.
title: Delhi HC orders complete resumption of physical courts from Nov 22 | National News | Inshorts
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

news_articles: By Ravi JalhotraNew Delhi [India], October 29 (ANI): After Delhi Police started removing barricades and cemented blocks that had been put at Gazipur and Tikri borders due to farmers protest, Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana said the general public was facing a lot of problems so the barricades were opened for their convenience. In an exclusive interview to ANI, Asthana said, "General public who travel on regular basis was facing a lot of problem due to this, so we decided to open the borders for the sake of their convenience."He also said that barricades continued due to the farmers' protest which affected interstate travel of people and commercial vehicles. "After holding talks with farm leaders, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana police officials, it was decided to open borders and create a positive atmosphere," he said.Assuring the preparedness to tackle any kind of situation in Delhi, Asthana said that the national capital is ready to deal with any situation.  "We will act in a graded manner. We are also preparing to tackle any law and order situation if it arises. We are prepared for any situation. We want to give a message that the situation is normal. I am confident that we'll handle any situation," he added.Earlier today, Delhi police have started removing barricades and cemented blocks put up at the Gazipur and Tikri borders after the blockage of almost 11 months due to the farmers' agitation against Central farm laws.On Thursday, police started the process of removing barricades placed at the Tikri border allowing traffic movement from New Delhi to Haryana.This initiative have been taken after Supreme Court on October 21 said that farmers have the right to protest but roads cannot be blocked indefinitely. The barricades were placed in the wake of the January 26 violence during the farmers' protest.Thousands of protestors broke barricades to enter Delhi and indulged in vandalism across several parts of the national capital during their tractor rally organised to protest against the Centre's three new farm laws on January 26 this year.Farmers have been protesting at different sites since November 26 last year against the three enacted farm laws: Farmers' Produce Trade and Commerce (Promotion and Facilitation) Act, 2020; the Farmers Empowerment and Protection) Agreement on Price Assurance and farm Services Act 2020 and the Essential Commodities (Amendment) Act, 2020. (ANI)
title: Barricades being removed at Gazipur, Tikri borders for public convenience: Delhi CP Rakesh Asthana

news_articles: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has emerged as the sole candidate to be the World Health Organization's (WHO) chief, paving the way for a second term, the UN agency said on Friday. Tedros, who was nominated by 28 countries, was the first African elected as WHO Director-General in May 2017. Tedros had previously served as the Health and Foreign Minister of Ethiopia.
title: Tedros sole candidate for WHO chief's post: UN agency | World News | Inshorts
author: ShaileshShailesh

news_articles: Nawazuddin Siddiqui has said he'll not be doing any more web series. The 'Sacred Games' actor added that the platform has become a "dumping ground" for "redundant shows". "It's become dhanda (racket) for big production houses and actors who are now so-called stars on the OTT platform...Producers get whopping amounts to create unlimited content. Quantity has killed quality," he said.
title: It has become dumping ground for redundant shows: Nawaz on quitting OTT | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

news_articles: Spain Consumer Affairs Minister Alberto Garzón has said that the country will ban advertisements of unhealthy foods and drinks such as chocolate and ice cream aimed at children to prevent obesity among them. While a cabinet approval is needed for this, Garzón said advertisements of five categories of products for minors, regardless of their nutritional content will be prohibited.
title: Spain to ban chocolate, ice cream ads targeting kids to prevent obesity | World News | Inshorts
author: Ridham GambhirRidham Gambhir

news_articles: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has written to Karnataka State Pollution Control Board seeking action against the Bengaluru sewerage board (BWSSB). BBMP officials said the sewerage board failed to prevent the entry of sewage into lakes. According to the CAG report, out of the 1,440 MLD sewage generated in BBMP area, about 780 MLD was discharged into stormwater drains without treatment.
title: BBMP seeks action against BWSSB over sewage inflow to B'luru lakes | National News | Inshorts
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

news_articles: The Supreme Court on Friday said that there was no total ban on firecrackers' use and only those crackers that are harmful to the health of citizens are banned. Asserting that crackers with barium salts are prohibited, SC said, "Celebration cannot be at the cost of others' health." It directed states/UTs to strictly implement a ban on harmful crackers.
title: All firecrackers are not banned, those with barium salts are prohibited: SC | National News | Inshorts
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

news_articles: The live broadcast of US President Joe Biden's meeting with Pope Francis in Vatican City was abruptly cancelled, drawing complaints from the White House and Vatican-accredited journalists. The broadcast showed only the arrival of Biden's motorcade in the courtyard of the Apostolic Palace. According to Vatican protocols, independent media has been restricted from covering the Pope due to COVID-19.
title: Vatican cuts short live broadcast of Biden's meeting with Pope | World News | Inshorts
author: ShaileshShailesh

news_articles: The 40th edition of the India International Trade Fair (IITF) will begin from November 14 at New Delhi's Pragati Maidan and will conclude on November 27. The theme of the fair will be 'AatmaNirbhar Bharat'. Over 2,000 exhibitors from India and other countries are expected to participate in the fair. Notably, the fair wasn't held last year amid COVID-19 pandemic.
title: India International Trade Fair to begin from November 14 in Delhi | National News | Inshorts
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

news_articles: Manoj Bajpayee spoke about how his family reacted to his show 'The Family Man' and said, "Both Shabana (wife) and Ava Nayla (daughter) have loved the show." He added that Shabana is "brutally honest" when she reviews his films and performances. "If she doesn't like something, she will critique me extremely honestly for it. But I like that," Manoj said.
title: My wife is brutally honest while reviewing my performances: Manoj | Entertainment News | Inshorts
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

news_articles: PharmEasy, an online pharmacy app, is offering flat 25% off & up to ₹5,000 cashback on 1st medicine order and also a 30% off on 1st diabetes medicine order during the sale period. "Along with fantastic offers on medicines & healthcare products, you also get 4-hour Express Delivery," said PharmEasy. The sale ends on 31st October.CoinSwitch Kuber has launched 'CSK Referral League' coinciding with the ongoing T20 World Cup. Users can participate by visiting the app and inviting friends to join CoinSwitch Kuber. The crypto trading app promises to reward top 100 daily winners from the referral leaderboard with bitcoin worth up to ₹2 lakh and one lucky winner will win bitcoin worth ₹5 lakh.Navi Health Insurance has announced a health plan with no limit on hospital room charges, irrespective of the sum insured. "We want our policy-holders to recover comfortably, in a hospital room of their choice, so, we're offering no restrictions on hospital room charges," it said. Navi further promises Health Insurance Plans with easy and affordable monthly premiums starting at ₹241/month.Navi Mutual Fund is offering investors the option to start Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) with ₹500 on its app. “With the recent spike in demand for mutual funds, Navi promises to offer a hassle-free digital experience to users and it is emerging as a preferred platform for direct investments”, the company said. Users can start investing via the Navi app.Sachin Bansal's Navi Health Insurance is offering monthly premiums starting at ₹241/month. With a 12 lakh+ customer base, 10,000+ network hospitals and 97% claim settlement ratio, Navi Health Insurance offers a wide range of exclusive benefits, like no limit on room rent, unlimited online doctor consultations at no extra cost, free refill of sum insured and more, the company announced.Epigamia revealed that its Strawberry Greek Yogurt is the classic pairing of strawberries and cream coming alive in a cup. It offers fresh strawberries from Mahabaleshwar and Epigamia's thick high-protein Greek yogurt together, promising a timeless combination. This mid-meal snack is made from real ingredients with zero preservatives.Philips' range of air purifiers aims to improve indoor air quality by filtering nano-sized air pollutants including the smallest known virus and bacteria. Studies confirm that it seeks to provide protection against airborne particles which are transmitted via respiratory droplets and aerosols, the brand revealed. It also claims to remove 99.97% air pollutants in just 6 minutes.While Aluminium compound antacids are a popular solution for relieving acidity & bloating, experts at Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda have created a research-backed Ayurvedic juice to prevent them, announced Kapiva. "Digesti Care Juice is a mix of 5 ayurvedic herbs which boosts digestive juices' secretion," says Kapiva's Dr. Anand, adding, "Users should be able to recognize difference within 2 weeks."This Dhanteras, investing in gold is going to be beneficial, as per My Gold Guide. Gold investment is always a good idea as it tends to perform better in times of economic stress & helps safeguard savings, it said, adding that price of gold has almost doubled in past decade despite economic volatility and has acted as investors' safe haven.Bordering 25,000-acres of forest greens in Kandivali, Lodha Woods invites you to live in the lap of nature. With a ~14,000 sft. clubhouse and 30+ amenities, the 2 and 3-BHK residences offer decks and work-from-home rooms, with views of the Sanjay Gandhi National Park and forest garden within. It unveiled special launch prices and payment plans, valid till November 5.The heart of a brain-dead person in Kochi was flown to Chennai in under two hours and transplanted to a 51-year-old man at a hospital on Sunday. According to the hospital, the recipient was diagnosed with Dilated cardiomyopathy and was on a waiting list since February. Green corridors were created in Kochi and Chennai for the heart's speedy transport.A video of a giant snake being lifted up by a crane in the Dominican rainforest has gone viral online. It shows the snake, which is alive and reportedly 10-foot-long, slowly lifting its head up. The video, shared by a TikTok user has got millions of views, with many speculating that the snake may be the world's largest on record.The Delhi High Court has directed AIIMS to pay over ₹50 lakh to a former employee, Raj Singh, who was illegally terminated in 1998. The HC said the amount is to be paid towards his salary from December 4, 1998, till October 31, 2016, his leave encashment and gratuity. He was appointed as a driver by AIIMS in the 1980s.A two-headed calf with a pig-like body was recently born in Russia's Khakassia. However, the calf did not survive and its mother also died a few days later. Khakassia's Veterinary Medicine Department said, "The main reason for animals being born with genetic abnormalities is a change in the genome. The reasons for mutations...are caused by their external and internal environment."A doctor found a live spider inside a woman's ear in China after she complained of discomfort in her ear and hearing strange noise. A picture of the spider inside her ear has also surfaced online. The woman reportedly visited the doctor when itching inside her ear became unbearable and she assumed that she had an infection.A video showing two ostriches running alongside vehicles on the Canal Road in Pakistan's Lahore has gone viral on social media. Pakistani news channel ARY News reported that one of the flightless birds died after a man attempted to catch it from its neck. The ostriches had reportedly escaped from somewhere in the outskirts of Lahore.A man in Egypt swallowed a mobile phone six months ago but didn't seek help as he hoped it'd pass through his body naturally. He finally sought help when his stomach pain increased. Doctors spotted the phone inside his stomach through X-ray following which the man underwent emergency surgery. The operation took place at Aswan University Hospital.Jayne Rivera, a model-influencer from Florida, has been criticised for posting photos of herself posing next to her father's coffin at his funeral. She captioned the post, "Butterfly fly away. Rip Papi you were my best friend. A life well-lived." After people criticised her for being disrespectful and called the photoshoot "vile" and "disgusting", she deactivated her Instagram account.An airplane dropped human waste on a man sitting in his garden near Windsor Castle in the UK. Speaking to The Royal Borough Of Windsor and Maidenhead's aviation forum, councillor Karen Davies said she was "horrified" to hear of the incident. "His whole garden was splattered in a very unpleasant way...Hopefully it never happens again," she added.A US man has been charged with fraud after he lied in his application for federal coronavirus relief aid and used relief money to buy a rare Pokémon card for $57,789 (over ₹43 lakh). The accused, Vinath Oudomsine, lied about the number of employees and his company's gross revenue in the application. Following his application, he received $85,000 aid.A fully-furnished flat with a hidden kitchen is available for rent for £800 a week, reports have said. Pictures of the flat, located in UK's Chelsea in London, have shown that its kitchen is hidden behind a decoy bookshelf that appears to be full of leather-bound books. The apartment description says the kitchen is "cleverly screened out of sight".Turkish photographer Mehmet Aslan's photo titled 'Hardship of Life' has won the Photo of the Year at Siena International Photo Awards. The man, Munzir, lost his leg in a bomb blast in Syria. The boy, Mustafa, was born without limbs due to tetra-amelia caused by medication his mother took after falling sick due to nerve gas released during Syrian war.An example of the world's first postage stamp, the Penny Black, is being offered at auction with a price estimate of up to $8.25 million (almost ₹62 crore). Dating from 1840, the item is "the earliest securely dated example of the first postage stamp," according to auction house Sotheby's. The adhesive stamp features a profile of Queen Victoria.A Chinese millionaire withdrew 5 million yuan (₹5.8 crore) from his account and asked the bank staff to count them note by note after a guard asked him to wear a face mask. The millionaire said he'll withdraw all his money from the Bank of Shanghai branch and put it in other banks as their staff had the "worst attitude". Thane traffic police have issued challans against 101 vehicles of policemen, advocates and common citizens for parking in 'No Parking' zones. While citizens were fined ₹200, policemen and advocates were fined an additional ₹200 for the police and advocate stickers, an officer said. Out of the total vehicles, 80 belonged to policemen and 21 were of advocates and common citizens.
title: Miscellaneous News: Current Affaires Updates in English with Inshorts

news_articles: During an interview, Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen said that she had faith the US would defend Taiwan if China made a move against the island. She confirmed the presence of US troops on the island for training purposes. She said, "Taiwan isn't alone...we share our values with most...countries." This comes amid repeated violations of Taiwan's airspace by the Chinese military.
title: I've faith US would defend Taiwan: Prez Tsai Ing-wen amid China tensions | World News | Inshorts

news_articles: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO was subscribed 100% within an hour of opening on Thursday, according to BSE data. However, its overall subscription stood at 0.24 times after an hour. The price band for the IPO, which will remain open till November 1, was fixed at ₹1,085-1,125 per share. The company is seeking a valuation of about ₹53,204 crore.
title: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO fully booked in an hour of opening | Business News | Inshorts

news_articles: Nykaa operator FSN E-Commerce Ventures has raised ₹2,396 crore from investors ahead of its initial public offer (IPO). The funding saw participation from T Rowe Price, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, SBI Mutual Fund, Axis Mutual Fund, Government Of Singapore and ICICI Prudential, among others. news_articles: A police head constable's four-year-old son died after he accidentally shot himself with the service pistol of his father in North Goa's Bicholim sub-district. The deceased's father had returned home from duty and had left the gun in the drawing-room, when the boy picked it and shot himself. Meanwhile, police have registered a case of unnatural death in the incident.

Pakistani news channel ARY News reported that one of the flightless birds died after a man attempted to catch it from its neck. The ostriches had reportedly escaped from somewhere in the outskirts of Lahore.

news_articles: US General Mark Milley has confirmed that China recently conducted a test of a hypersonic weapon system. Milley said, "[It] was a...significant event of a test of a hypersonic weapon system...[It's] very concerning." In July, China had launched a nuclear-capable hypersonic weapon that orbited the earth before reentering the atmosphere and finally missing its test target, Financial Times reported.

news_articles: Amazon has reported that its net income decreased to $3.2 billion in the third quarter compared with $6.3 billion in the third quarter of 2020, reportedly its largest year-over-year decline since 2017. Its revenue for the quarter stood at $110.81 billion, up 15% compared to the year-ago period. Amazon shares dropped over 4% in extended trading on Thursday.

The five-year-old Bengaluru-based startup's valuation has risen to $1.1 billion, making it India's 34th unicorn this year. news_articles: New Delhi [India], October 28 (ANI): The Ministry of Finance on Thursday released Rs 44,000 crore to the states and union territories with legislature under the back-to-back loan facility in lieu of GST compensation.As per an official release, after taking into account the earlier release of Rs 1,15,000 crore (Rs 75,000 crore released on July 15, 2021, and Rs 40,000 crore released on October 7, 2021), the total amount released in the current financial year as a back-to-back loan in-lieu of GST compensation is Rs 1,59,000 crore. This release is in addition to normal GST compensation being released every two months out of actual cess collection.Subsequent to the 43rd GST council meeting held on May 28, 2021, it was decided that the central government would borrow Rs 1.59 lakh crore and release it to states and union territories with the legislature on a back-to-back basis to meet the resource gap due to the short release of compensation on account of the inadequate amount in the compensation fund.  This amount is as per the principles adopted for a similar facility in Financial Year 2020-2021, where an amount of Rs 1.10 lakh crore was released to states under a similar arrangement. This amount of Rs 1.59 lakh crore would be over and above the compensation in excess of Rs 1 lakh crore (based on cess collection) that is estimated to be released to states, union territories with legislature during this financial year. The sum total of Rs 2.59 lakh crore is expected to exceed the amount of GST compensation accruing in FY 2021-2022.All eligible states and UTs (with Legislature) have agreed to the arrangements of funding of the compensation shortfall under the back-to-back loan facility. For effective response and management of COVID-19 pandemic and a step-up in capital expenditure, all states and union territories have a very important role to play. For assisting the states/UTs in their endeavour, the Ministry of Finance has frontloaded the release of assistance under the back-to-back loan facility during FY 2021-22 of Rs 1,59,000 crore.The release of Rs 44,000 crore being made now is funded from borrowings of government in five-year securities issued in the current financial year, at a Weighted Average Yield of 5.69 per cent. No additional market borrowing by the central government is envisaged on account of this release.It is expected that this release will help the states, union territories in planning their public expenditure among other things, for improving, health infrastructure and taking up infrastructure projects. (ANI)
title: Centre releases balance amount of Rs 44,000 cr to states, UTs under back-to-back loan facility in-lieu of GST compensation

news_articles: The Centre has extended COVID-19 restrictions across the country till November 30. In its earlier order, the government said no mass gatherings should be allowed in containment zones and in districts reporting more than 5% case positivity. The government also asked states to follow five pillars of COVID-19 management i.e. "Test-Track-Treat-Vaccinate and adherence to COVID appropriate behaviour".
title: Centre extends COVID-19 restrictions across country till November 30 | Coronavirus News | Inshorts

news_articles: Pune airport Director Santosh Dhoke on Friday said flight operations at the airport will resume at 8 am on Saturday. The airport had stopped operating for 14 days starting October 16, after the Air Force decided to undertake runway resurfacing work. Dhoke said the embargo on night flights (8 pm to 8 am) will continue for a while.

Microsoft's shares jumped 4.2% to end at a record $323.17 after it reported a net income of $20.5 billion in the September-quarter. Its market capitalisation surged to $2.426 trillion, just short of Apple's $2.461 trillion valuation, Refinitiv data showed.
